text.p: Here are highlights from Polish newspapers this morning.
PRESS DIGEST JUNE 12 FRONT PAGE POLITICAL NEWS
RZECZPOSPOLITA
- The supervisory board of the state-owned national television broadcaster (TVP) has dismissed Tomasz Jezioranski from the post of financial director.
DZIENNIK PRAWA I GOSPODARKI

- A group of 13 members of the ex-communist Social Democracy of the Polish Republic (SDRP), a core party of the co-ruling Democratic Left Alliance (SLD), has proposed changes in party leadership. No further details were disclosed.
- A buffer zone separating the Polish and Russian fishing areas in the Baltic has been created to avoid border incidents and fishing boats' arrests in the future.
ECONOMIC AND MARKET STORIES
RZECZPOSPOLITA

- Polish-Ukrainian trade exchange will reach $2.0 billion in 1997, showing significant growth compared with $1.4 billion last year, a senior diplomat in the Ukrainian embassy in Warsaw Siergiei Czebotar said.

- A consortium including Denmark's A/S Roulunds Fabriker and the Central and Eastern European Investment Fund has bought an 80 percent share stake in the Fomar friction lining maker in Marki, central Poland, worth $3.2 million.

- Petrol fuel prices may inch up by 0.06 zloty per litre following the abolition of road tax and the resulting excise tax increase, Poland's transport and marine economy minister Boguslaw Liberadzki said.
- Poland's mining sector made a net loss of 490.9 million in the first quarter of 1997, showing a 200 percent upturn compared with the same period last year, the economy ministry said.

- PZL Swidnik aircraft maker has signed a five year cooperation agreement with the German Eurocopter Deutschland helicopter plant in Donauworth. PZL Swidnik will make parts of doors for Airbus passenger aircraft.
- The Industrial Bank of Korea will shortly open a representative office in Poland, the bank said.
- Poland's biggest insurance firm PZU SA earned a net profit of 62 million zlotys in the first quarter of 1997, showing a 51 percent growth compared with the same period last year, the firm said.
DZIENNIK PRAWA I GOSPODARKI
- Poland's revenues from privatisation will reach around 4.5 billion zlotys this year, the treasury minister Miroslaw Pietrewicz said.
GAZETA WYBORCZA
- Poland's pet-food sales exceeded $70 million in 1996, the Euro Zoo pet-food wholesaler in Warsaw said.
ZYCIE
- South Korea's LG Electronics will invest $500 million in Poland. The firm plans to build a television equipment plant in the country.
PARKIET
- The Grajewo chipboard maker has applied to the Warsaw bourse board for moving its stock from the exchange's parallel to main floor.
NOTE - Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-- Warsaw Newsroom +48 22 653 9700
